numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In all categories, young women are more likely than young men to reach out.
2. Young people are most likely to reach out to a parent by sending a text message.
3. Young people are least likely to visit a parent in person.
4. There are noticeable gaps between the percentages of young women and young men.
5. Less than 50 percent of young men reach out by sending a text message.
6. Less than 75 percent of young women reach out by sending a text message.
7. Around 30 percent of young men reach out by phone-call or video-chat.
8. More than 50 percent of young women reach out by phone-call or video-chat.
9. Visiting in person has the smallest difference between young women and young men.
10. The difference for visiting in person is around 5 percent.
11. The percentage for visiting in person is 25 percent or less.
12. Young women are more likely than young men to reach out.
13. The reason is unknown.
14. A question is: Why are young women more likely than young men to reach out?
15. A question is: How do these people describe their relationships with their parents?
16. Family is a big part of many people's lives.
17. Some people cannot see all parts of their family in person.
18. There are alternatives to reach out.
19. We live in a modern digital world.
20. It is not always convenient to visit in person.
21. A person can make a phone call.
22. A person can send a text message.
23. The headline is: Going Digital: Keeping in Touch with Loved Ones.
